author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sana Iqbal, who is on an all India expedition on two-wheeler to create awareness against the tendency of committing suicide, held an interaction session with the students of a couple of engineering colleges in the city on Thursday.

The event was brought up jointly by the Confederation of Indian Industry and Young Indians – Salem Chapter. Ms. Sana Iqbal, hailing from Hyderabad, addressed interaction sessions at Sona College of Technology and Narasus Institute of Technology.

She said that she had been covering each and every State and Union Territory on her two-wheeler to campaign particularly among the youth against suicide tendency.

“Suicide is not the solution. There is an alternative for depression,” she told the college students.

She explained how the youngsters could keep themselves happy by overcoming depression.

The students should take steps to spread happiness among their family members and neighbours.

Ms. Sana Iqbal has, so far, visited more than 56 cities covering 20,000 km and also addressed students of a number of educational institutions.

Yatin B. Shah, Chair Yi Salem Chapter, and V. Aravinthan, former Chair, were present.
title: Creating awareness against suicide tendency
